alert.note: Alert for Escambia; Santa Rosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 1:21AM EDT until June 16 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Escambia County in northwestern Florida... South Central Santa Rosa County in northwestern Florida... * Until 345 AM CDT. * At 1221 AM CDT, This is quickly becoming a LIFE THREATENING SITUATION across the warned area. The public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Gauge reports show between 5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pensacola, Warrington, Gulf Breeze, Goulding, Oriole Beach, Pensacola Beach, Villa Sabine, Brownsville, Garcon Point, Beach Haven and Pleasant Grove. This includes the following streams and drainages... Carpenter Creek, Pensacola Bay, Bridge Creek and Bellshead Branch. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
